title: Biltmore Estate CX - NCCX Series Finals
January Mountain Bike Marathon
description:
STORM ENDURANCE SPORTS 8th ANNUAL
REGISTER ONLINE AT: www.stormendurance.com
January Mountain Bike Marathon 
Sunday January 25, 2015
Governor’s Creek, Sanford, NC

Start off your 2015 season with the 8th annual January Mountain Bike Marathon at North Carolina’s original trail destination, Governor’s Creek. The mountain bike-training ride will be a cross-country mountain bike ride of approximately 42 miles. Riders will do one 6-mile lap around Governor’s Creek, head out for a 30-mile loop on paved and dirt roads, and return for a final 6-mile circuit on the trail. The average January high temperature is 52 and the average low is 29. In the event of threatening weather, please check the event website for the latest ride information.

Mt Bike Marathon 

This is a training event on trails and roads. We have free pizza afterwards. Riders will be scored and assigned a placing. All Classes will start at the same time and be scored in the categories below. Use this event for early season training. This ride is longer than a normal XC race and it could be very cold. 

The middle portion of the course will be on lightly traveled, paved and dirt roads that are open to vehicle traffic. No traffic control will be provided. Participants must obey all state traffic regulations. Riders will need to dress accordingly for the weather and pace and feed themselves accordingly for the longer distance. Expect a first place finishing time of around 2 1/2 hours. Riders could take up to 4 hours or more to complete. Be Prepared for Anything.

SCHEDULE OF EVENTS
Time Category Laps Miles Awards
12:00 noon Mountain bike mass start: 
Men under 40 1 42 None
Women under 40 1 42 None
Men 40+ 1 42 None
Women 40+ 1 42 None
Men 50+ 1 42 None
Open Singlespeed 1 42 None
Clydesdale 205+ lbs 1 42 None

DIRECTIONS TO GOVERNOR’S CREEK
• Coming South on US #1.Take a right at the 2nd Stoplight onto Center Church Rd. in Tramway. 
• Coming North on US #1 make a left on Center Church Rd in Tramway.
Continue on Center Church Road until you come to a stop sign (T intersection), take left onto S. Plank Rd. Take 1st right onto Stanton Hill Dr. Take 1st right onto Underwood Dr., stay to the right on Underwood Dr., and Governor’s Creek MTB park will be on your right.

REGISTRATION INFORMATION

$25 early (online closes 10pm Thursday Jan 22)
$25 early at Storm Endurance Sports (closes 5pm Thursday Jan 22) 
$35 day of registration

A USAC sanctioned event
All riders will sign the standard USAC waiver form to participate

title: Mars Hill Summer Camp
description: A summer cycling camp in the heart of the Blue Ridge Mountains geared toward developing junior and collegiate cyclists. June 14-19 on the campus of Mars Hill University.
course: 5 days of riding in Madison County, NC, including courses used for 2015 USAC Collegiate Road Nationals and a ride to the top of Mt. Mitchell, highest peak east of the Mississippi River. Nightly presentations from elite coaches, pro riders, and industry experts.
notes:
BENEFITS:
• Riding in the beautiful mountains.
• All meals and training fuel provided.
• PowerTap wheels to demo for all campers.
• Free official Mars Hill College team jersey (If registered April 20)
• USAC upgrade points for attending camp: 3pts if upgrading from 4-3
• Led by USAC certified coaches, national champions, and professionals.

TOPICS COVERED:
• Race strategy and tactics for individuals and teams
• Skills and bike handling sessions
• Racing and training with a power meter
• Endurance training plans and goal setting
• Race preparation, fueling, and recovery
• Aerodynamics, power-to-weight, and equipment selection
• Mechanics workshop covering maintenance and basic repair
• Core strength, flexibility, and proper bike fit
• Climbing, descending, sprinting, cornering, time trialing, attacking, bridging
directions: Directions to Camp: Our location is Brown Hall on the campus of Mars Hill University. From I-26 take exit 11. Go left at the stop sign or stoplight. Climb the hill to the first light at Main Street. Take a left onto Main Street and then first right onto Dormitory Road. Then take first right into parking lot that leads to three residence halls. Brown Hall is the two-story brick building at the far end.

title: Battle of the Bikes at Country Park
North Carolina High Country Junior MTB Rides
Caorilnas Cycling Association Regional (NC/SC) Road Race Cha
THE Herbalife CCA Regional Criterium Championships
Hot Doggett 100
description:
Time to think about Hot Doggett 2015.  This will be our tenth, and best yet, Hot Doggett.

Here’s a short preview:

We will again be based on the beautiful Mars Hill University campus.

In addition to our normal routes for both the Doggett Mountain Challenge 100 mile ride and the Devils Fork Metric, in 2014 we added a shorter (60 km) ride – the Big Laurel Grind – which will be available again this year.  While it doesn’t have the climbs of Doggett Mountain, Devil’s Fork or Sam’s Gap, the Big Laurel Grind lives up to its name by providing the challenge of the mountains of Madison County with a slow gradual climb over a shorter distance.

Chip timing will be back for a second year. You asked for it and we listened.

And again this year we are offering a special promotion for racing and recreational bike clubs – clubs with six or more riders will receive a rebate of $7 per rider.  So if 10 members of a club participate, the club will receive a check for $70!  Be sure to list your bike club affiliation when you register.

Remember, the Hot Doggett offers on-campus accommodation, eight fully supported rest stops, awesome SAG support, free post-ride showers, post ride meal, great “swag bags” including a commemorative t-shirt and the opportunity to purchase a 2015 Hot Doggett cyclist jersey (more information to follow on this).

We hope you come help us celebrate the 10th anniversary Hot Doggett on July 11, 2015.

visit-madison-county

Rick and Connie Molland
2015 Co-chairs
Hot Doggett 100
course:
http://hotdoggett100.org/courses/

There are three courses to choose from listed below.

Doggett Mountain Challenge 100 Mile Century Ride
Saturday, July 11, 2015 – 7:30 AM Start-time

Devil’s Fork 100 Kilometer Metric Century Ride
Saturday, July 11, 2015 – 8:00 AM Start-time

Big Laurel Grind 60 Kilometer Ride
Saturday, July 11, 2015 – 8:30 AM Start-time

title: Goldsboro Downtown Criterium
description: All races will be hosted in Goldsboro, NC. Races will be held rain or shine. No refunds.
course: Flat and fast on wide streets in downtown Goldsboro.
registration: Pre-registration is $35/race; $40/race day of. Registration opens day of race at 8:30 a.m. Entry fees include a $3.00 per rider USAC insurance fee and a $1.00 per rider CCA fee. Race organizer reserves the right to combine fields, reduce payout or cancel events due to inclement weather or low racer turnout.
notes: Great curbside restaurants! English breakfast, Tex-Mex, Irish pub, Asian fusion and local shopping to boot!
directions: Goldsboro is a short 30 minute drive from Greenville, 1 hour from Raleigh or Fayetteville, and less than 1.5 from Wilmington.

title: Bookwalter Binge

address.street: Pisgah Brewing, 150 Eastside Drive, Black Mountain

description: The BB Charity Gran Fondo is a bike ride in which cyclists ride a challenging 30 or 83 mile course. Participants are able to enjoy the colorful fall foliage and experience the hospitality and charm of Black Mountain and Asheville. Participants ride and converse with past, present, and future cycling celebrities, who join the ride as guides and guests.   For more information, check out Bookwalterbinge.com and facebook.com/bookwalterbinge.
course: The ride begins and ends at Pisgah Brewing in Black Mountain, NC. The courses are marked, and follow cars are on route. There are four aid stations in the 83 mile route, and two in the 30 mile route. There are 3 timed mountain climbing sections for those that wish to compete during the ride. The aid stations are staffed by volunteers handing out snacks, sports drinks, and water, and some stations have bike mechanics. There is a rolling road block for the first 5 miles, and intersections that are particularly dangerous have crossing guards.
directions: Pisgah Brewing, 50 Eastside Drive, Black Mountain, NC 28711, United States
